segment.source: Mouse mode is on by default for all applications.
segment.target: Mouse mode is on by default for all applications.

segment.source: This means all applications that have not opted out will recieve a mouse pointer (similar to the one in the Edge browser on the console).
segment.target: This means all applications that have not opted out will recieve a mouse pointer (similar to the one in the Edge browser on the console).

segment.source: We strongly recommend you turn this off and optimize for directional controller navigation.
segment.target: We strongly recommend you turn this off and optimize for directional controller navigation.

segment.source: To turn off mouse mode, add the following to a JavaScript file in your application:
segment.target: To turn off mouse mode, add the following to a JavaScript file in your application:

segment.source: To turn off mouse mode, add the following to a JavaScript file in your application:
segment.target: To turn off mouse mode, add the following to a JavaScript file in your application:

segment.source: If you are writing a C++/DirectX app, there's nothing to do.
segment.target: If you are writing a C++/DirectX app, there's nothing to do.

segment.source: Mouse mode only applies to HTML and XAML applications.
segment.target: Mouse mode only applies to HTML and XAML applications.
